I haven’t been too sure what case -1 and -2 specifically did, but i know they dealt with going up and down heights via globalobjects.

Read full topic

item.title: Castle Wars Stairs
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

No, I’m not. But…I found a working ladder and searched for it in my client…this is what I found:

    case -1:
        if (!IsUsingSkill) {
            if (objectID == 1747 || objectID == 1750) {
                stairs = 1;
                skillX = objectX;
                skillY = objectY;
                stairDistance = 1;
            } else if (objectID == 1738) {
                stairs = 1;
                skillX = objectX;
                skillY = objectY;
                stairDistance = 2;
            } else if (objectID == 1722) {
                stairs = 21;
                skillX = objectX;
                skillY = objectY;
                stairDistance = 2;
                stairDistanceAdd = 2;
            } else if (objectID == 1734) {
                stairs = 10;
                skillX = objectX;
                skillY = objectY;
                stairDistance = 3;
                stairDistanceAdd = 1;

And then that goes on for a little longer…What is that…?

Read full topic

@The_Reaper_X wrote:

So you’re floating, and when you log off - log back in, you’re at a new location?

item.title: Castle Wars Stairs

item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

Well, I can get to the location specified and it has the same coordinates…

Read full topic

item.title: Castle Wars Stairs
item.dc:creator: @The_Reaper_X The Reaper X
item.description:
@The_Reaper_X wrote:

Because it’s just using that location, with a +1 height (or something of that sort). Not all locations are located on the same coords, with a different height level.

Read full topic

item.title: Castle Wars Stairs
item.dc:creator: @Setsuna Setsuna
item.description:
@Setsuna wrote:

When I click on some stairs in castle wars I just added in, it sends me here instead of where it is suppost to, although the stairs are right above this point…:

errors3.jpg762×466

Here are my stair codes:

[code] case 4417://stairs
if (objectY == 3078 && objectX == 2419 && absX == 2419 && absY == 3077)
{
teleportToX = 2420;
teleportToY = 3080;
heightLevel = 1;
}

if (objectX == 2428 && objectY == 3081 && absX == 2427 && absY == 3081) 
{
  teleportToX = 2430;
  teleportToY = 3080;
  heightLevel = 2;
}

if (objectX == 2425 && objectY == 3074 && absX == 2425 && absY == 3077) 
{
  teleportToX = 2426;
  teleportToY = 3074;
  heightLevel = 3;
}[/code]

Read full topic
